item.title: Helena add a quote by Henry James
item.description: "I don't want everyone to like me; I should think less of myself if some people did." -- Henry James

item.title: Helena add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Helena add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "Parents are like God because you wanna know they're out there, and you want them to think well of you, but you really only call when you need something." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Helena add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I think God, in creating man, somewhat overestimated his ability." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Helena add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "All God does is watch us and kill us when we get boring. We must never, ever be boring." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Helena add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Helena add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "The trouble with having an open mind, of course, is that people will insist on coming along and trying to put things in it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Helena add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description:
"Do you hate people?
I don't hate them...I just feel better when they're not around." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Helena add a quote by E.B. White
item.description: "If the world were merely seductive, that would be easy. If it were merely challenging, that would be no problem. But I arise in the morning torn between a desire to improve the world and a desire to enjoy the world. This makes it hard to plan the day." -- E.B. White

item.title: Helena add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "Honest is how I want to look. The truth doesn't glitter and shine." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Helena add a quote by Khaled Hosseini
item.description: "But better to get hurt by the truth than comforted with a lie." -- Khaled Hosseini

item.title: Helena add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "When a person doesnâ€™t have gratitude, something is missing in his or her humanity. A person can almost be defined by his or her attitude toward gratitude." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Helena add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Keep away from people who try to belittle your ambitions. Small people always do that, but the really great make you feel that you, too, can become great." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Helena add a quote by Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
item.description: "Music is the universal language of mankind." -- Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

item.title: Helena add a quote by Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
item.description: "We judge ourselves by what we feel capable of doing, while others judge us by what we have already done." -- Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

item.title: Helena add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I find television very educating. Every time somebody turns on the set, I go into the other room and read a book." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Helena add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Helena add a quote by Spencer Johnson
item.description: "Integrity is telling myself the truth. And honesty is telling the truth to other people." -- Spencer Johnson

item.title: Helena add a quote by Emma Goldman
item.description: "The philosophy of Atheism represents a concept of life without any metaphysical Beyond or Divine Regulator. It is the concept of an actual, real world with its liberating, expanding and beautifying possibilities, as against an unreal world, which, with its spirits, oracles, and mean contentment has kept humanity in helpless degradation." -- Emma Goldman

item.title: Helena add a quote by Emma Goldman
item.description: "The most violent element in society is ignorance. " -- Emma Goldman

item.title: Helena add a quote by Emma Goldman
item.description: "Ask for work. If they don't give you work, ask for bread. If they do not give you work or bread, then take bread." -- Emma Goldman

item.title: Helena add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Helena add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "There are few people whom I really love, and still fewer of whom I think well. The more I see of the world, the more am I dissatisfied with it; and every day confirms my belief of the inconsistency of all human characters, and of the little dependence that can be placed on the appearance of merit or sense." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Helena add a quote by John Stuart Mill
item.description: "Bad men need nothing more to compass their ends, than that good men should look on and do nothing." -- John Stuart Mill

item.title: Helena add a quote by John Philpot Curran
item.description: "The price of freedom is eternal vigilance." -- John Philpot Curran

item.title: Helena add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: ". . . The spirit of resistance to government is so valuable on certain occasions, that I wish it to be always kept alive. It will often be exercised when wrong, but better so than not to be exercised at all. I like a little rebellion now and then. It is like a storm in the atmosphere." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Helena add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "Some are whigs, liberals, democrats, call them what you please. Others are tories, serviles, aristocrats, &c. The latter fear the people, and wish to transfer all power to the higher classes of society; the former consider the people as the safest depository of power in the last resort; they cherish them therefore, and wish to leave in them all the powers to the exercise of which they are competent." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Helena add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "They who can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety deserve neither liberty nor safety." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Helena add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Nobody realizes that some people expend tremendous energy merely to be normal." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Helena add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Should I kill myself, or have a cup of coffee?" -- Albert Camus
